58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (17:59): XE? are you trying to setup Oracle EXpress edition by the way ?
70b7d4916eea4cff0d9c24c4b80c7ca1 (18:00): yes
58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (18:00): ok, by default Oracle XE creates the SID as 'XE'
70b7d4916eea4cff0d9c24c4b80c7ca1 (18:02): In addition,
70b7d4916eea4cff0d9c24c4b80c7ca1 (18:02): users can run only one instance of the Oracle Database XE Server database on
70b7d4916eea4cff0d9c24c4b80c7ca1 (18:02): each individual computer.
70b7d4916eea4cff0d9c24c4b80c7ca1 (18:03): does that mean you can have only ONE database
70b7d4916eea4cff0d9c24c4b80c7ca1 (18:03): i'm not english , so some time i did'nt transate very well
58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (18:07): siddharta: http://www.oracle.com/technology/pub/articles/cunningham-database-xe.html
58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (18:08): check out the limitations ..only 1 database per box
58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (18:08): "The third limit is that only a single XE database can run on any given computer.... "
70b7d4916eea4cff0d9c24c4b80c7ca1 (18:13): oki so i will have to rename the database XE to Cimaise
70b7d4916eea4cff0d9c24c4b80c7ca1 (18:16): boogieman: is it possible in sqlplus because it seems not via the web interfaces
58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (18:18): siddharta: hmm... normally, in Oracle, just change the tnsnames.ora file 'alias' entry to anything you need and access through that
58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (18:18): since I don't use XE, can't comment much
58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (18:23): siddharta: ok..went through a tutorial
58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (18:23): on which platform are you running this ?
58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (18:23): Windows, Linux or something else
58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (18:24): check the /etc/init.d/oracle-xe script (on linux) and you should be able to customize it to suit the DB SID you want (i think), open it up and see
58ea25453030aa1cda4c7b52097ab1f5 (18:25): XE intro : http://st-curriculum.oracle.com/tutorial/DBXETutorial/index.htm nice, with demos
b8b79520e4ce7684a19fcc4f0f00b8f0 (18:27): anyone know how I can get a list of the default enabled roles?
b8b79520e4ce7684a19fcc4f0f00b8f0 (18:28): I tried select count(*)
b8b79520e4ce7684a19fcc4f0f00b8f0 (18:28): from sys.user$, dba_roles
b8b79520e4ce7684a19fcc4f0f00b8f0 (18:28): where name=role and name not in

b8b79520e4ce7684a19fcc4f0f00b8f0 (18:28): ('AQ_ADMINISTRATOR_ROLE','AQ_USER_ROLE','AUTHENTICATEDUSER','CONNECT','CTXAPP','DBA','DELETE_CATALOG_ROLE','EJBCLIENT','EXECUTE_CATALOG_ROLE','EXP_FULL_DATABASE','GATHER_SYSTEM_STATISTICS','GLOBAL_AQ_USER_ROLE','HS_ADMIN_ROLE','IMP_FULL_DATABASE','JAVADEBUGPRIV','JAVAIDPRIV','JAVASYSPRIV','JAVAUSERPRIV','JAVA_ADMIN','JAVA_DEPLOY','LOGSTDBY_ADMINISTRATOR','OEM_MONITOR','PLUSTRACE','RECOVERY_CATALOG_OWNER','RESOURCE','SCHEDULER_ADMIN'

b8b79520e4ce7684a19fcc4f0f00b8f0 (18:28): which is more than the 148 max of max_enabled_roles

b8b79520e4ce7684a19fcc4f0f00b8f0 (18:43): select count(distinct granted_role) from dba_role_privs where default_role='YES' and GRANTED_ROLE not in ('AQ_ADMINISTRATOR_ROLE','AQ_USER_ROLE','AUTHENTICATEDUSER','CONNECT','CTXAPP','DBA','DELETE_CATALOG_ROLE','EJBCLIENT','EXECUTE_CATALOG_ROLE','EXP_FULL_DATABASE','GATHER_SYSTEM_STATISTICS','GLOBAL_AQ_USER_ROLE','HS_ADMIN_ROLE','IMP_FULL_DATABASE','JAVADEBUGPRIV','JAVAIDPRIV','JAVASYSPRIV','JAVAUSERPRIV','JAVA_ADMIN','JAVA_DEPLOY'
